Description: Handle sherd (mended from four fragments) of East Greek grey ware pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora or pithos; underside heavily grooved to create appearance of double handle; dark grey fabric with limestone and mica inclusions; dark grey slip on handle and exterior surface.
Curator's comments: For parallels at Antissa, see Lamb, ‘Antissa’, ‘The Annual of the British School at Athens’, Vol. 32 (1931/1932), fig. 6.a.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.024)
